title: Delete ADCs Please
body:
There is a hidden irony in what the board wants when they say they want to get rid of marksmen from the meta.

DPS is what takes objectives, and it's the one thing that truly counters tanks. Burst is weak against beefier champs due to high damage abilities on long cooldowns, and I think - judging by the board's cries over the {{item:3116}} nerf - everyone is aware that AP is more costly and less efficient over the long term than AD. So, without squishies to prey on, assassins would only be able to feed off other assassins, which would nullify their place in the game. Champs like {{champion:90}} would barely tickle heavy champs with any notable amount of MR. So the only burst champions that will be relevant are hyper mobile APCs - basically, {{champion:103}} every game. Good luck, assassin players. By deleting ADCs, Riot might as well delete you too.

Tank/bruiser battles will come down to who can outsustain. CC will be king, because the battles will come down to getting your high sustain champions to 1v1 or even 1v2 the enemy's more damage oriented champs. So if you aren't annoyed by {{champion:48}} already, you will be.

But you still need some DPS and someone capable of outright murdering tanks. Someone with movement speed, attack speed, and armor pen. Or maybe... TRUE DAMAGE. {{champion:157}} {{champion:114}} That's right, here's the irony: If you weren't already tired of {{champion:157}}, expect to see him even more _in spite_ of any upcoming nerfs.

Here's what a typical matchup would probably look like in an era with no marksmen.
{{champion:75}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:114}}
{{champion:122}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:157}} 

Can't wait to see one of these teamfights, can you? It will basically be everyone's health bars going up and down like a slinky as they desperately attempt to out-lifesteal each other.

there is really only 1 thing that needs to change to make adc not mandatory in this game.

either the xp distribution in duo lanes, which could be done via itemization. or fixing the melee/ranged lane matchups in general and make ranged adc/support duos less opressive.

for example, if all support items like {{item:3302}} would grant their partners additional xp to the point that duo laners would keep up in levels with the solo laners, then it would be possible to take level dependent champions into bot lane, as they would get (almost) equal xp and gold as in a solo lane.

the reason why {{champion:82}} xp mechanic was unfair, was because it granted him a **level advantage** over the enemy duo, as he would get the full amount of xp, while the enemy would not.

if just everyone in the game **on both sides** would roughly get the same xp/minute due to proper support itemization, then putting a level and gold dependent champion like an ap carry like {{champion:69}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:268}} or a bruiser like {{champion:82}}  into the duo lane would not gimp him compared to the ranged adc whos only gold dependent.

and it would not make assassins obsolete, because again. ranged adc arent the only type of squishy carry and possible damage threat on the enemy team.

Except you ignored the point about burst AP damage not being viable against tanks. And tanks (which come with CC) are mandatory to this game. How is that any different?

I don't think anyone mistakes that the ranged ADC is supposed to be the only one who can carry. Anyone can carry. I've seen Rammus carry.

The ecosystem of LoL is tank > mage/assassin > marksman > tank. By removing the marksmen, you are removing the tank's predator, which will in turn overpopulate tanks because burst does not threaten them except maybe in the early game. Ask Katarina what she thinks about Leona. Aassassins do not provide DPS and they do not deal well with CC, which the majority of tanks are loaded with.
